messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] WORK FROM HOME GET PAID DAILY!
messages.msgSnippet: ... Back in college when the Holy Grail first came out and eveyone was quoting it, I didn t get it. Over summer break as I rested from my school ordeal, back
messages.messageBody:
on 10/31/02 5:29 PM, Tia Leschke at leschke@... wrote:

> One of these days I'll try Monty Python again. When I tried watching it
> long ago, I just couldn't get past all the bathroom humour.

Back in college when the Holy Grail first came out and eveyone was quoting
it, I didn't get it. Over summer break as I rested from my school ordeal,
back in the days when HBO had only a few movies and played each 5 times a
day, I must have watched Monty Python and the Holy Grail 35 times.
Literally. And I finally got it. It didn't take me all 30 times to get it
;-) but it did take a lot!

Some of us are a bit slower than others. ;-)

Joyce

> that he may quote it evermore." ?

One of these days I'll try Monty Python again. When I tried watching it
long ago, I just couldn't get past all the bathroom humour.
Tia

messages.subject: Re: WORK FROM HOME GET PAID DAILY!
messages.msgSnippet: Pam, There is an option to moderate new members only. Anyone can still subscribe, but their initial messages will not go to the list until approved by a
messages.messageBody:
Pam,

There is an option to moderate new members only. Anyone can still
subscribe, but their initial messages will not go to the list until
approved by a moderator. If their first message is spam, you can then
ban them from the group without having the message go through.

I am "no mail" status for this list meaning I only read the posts on-
line which also means I cannot see the e-mail address of the spammer.
The moderator or any one else actually receiving the message by email
should forward the message to abuse@yahoogroups.com and abuse@
whatever the domain was for the jayma818@m... (all that shows when
you read on-line) address.

Those steps should get their yahoo account closed so they can't use
it to spam again and will get the response address closed so they
can't benefit by receiving replies to their spam.

Billy
www.FUN-Books.com

--- In AlwaysLearning@y..., Pam Hartley <pamhartley@m...> wrote:
> Apparently the spammer has already unsubscribed themselves. Sorry
guys,
> unless we go to "approved membership" we're vulnerable to these
drive-by
> adverts.
>
> Pam

It may be time to moderate new members for a post or two?
Elissa
